turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Um ... They like wanna ask you a question ... I didn't know how to handle it. So ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Okay look, this like--wasn't my fault. They asked me what it was about and I like didn't remember 'cause we had it back in tenth grade, But I told them what I DID remember, and the next thing I knew the pages had filled in.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: The pages filled in?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: But like only up to the part about the raft, because I didn't read any farther.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Nothing?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You're reading?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Yeah. Can't believe you started such a dorky fad.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: D.H. Lawrence. You ever heard of him?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: ... Yeah.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Seemed kinda sexy. Look. I read 35 pages.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: That's great.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: So what is it?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Well ... I just ...  Can I ask you a question?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Remember when you told me that Lisa Rosenberg liked me?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Yeah ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Well--did she really like me or were you just making that up.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: No. She really liked you.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You weren't playing a joke? She woulda gone out with me?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Gone out with you. She woulda like rearranged your tonsils.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Wow.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Can I ask you a question?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: How come I'm still in black and white?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Well I've had like ten times as much sex as these girls and I'm still like this. They have one hour in the back of a car and suddenly they're in technicolor.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh, I don't know. Maybe ...  ... it's not just the sex ...

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I told you. I'm like positive.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: This thing works. We could go home right now.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I'm not ready yet. I gotta do this for a little while.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Besides. You think there's like a chance I'm gonna get into college back there?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Honestly ... no.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You got the admissions letter.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Right here.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: And you're sure about this?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I've done the slut thing, David. It's really kinda old.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: That was sure swell ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh. Thanks, Margaret.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: I baked you my oatmeal cookies.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh, no ... You baked those for Whitey.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: No. I baked them for you.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No. You baked them for Whitey.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: No. I baked them for you.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Keeps going ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Well--it all just keeps going. Roads ... rivers ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Oh ... Hi.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Look, I probably shouldn't be asking you this--not knowing you that well and all ...

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Sure ... Where would we go?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: ... Lover's Lane?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Um ... You gotta turn off Main Street.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh ... Right.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Mmmmgh.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Do they have those ... Where you come from?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yeah ... I guess.  I don't know.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: You don't know?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: So what's it like?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Out there.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Well it's louder ... And scarier I guess ... And ... and a lot more dangerous ...

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Sounds fantastic. You know some kids came up here the other night to go swimming--took off all their clothes.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Do they have an Ocean? I've heard about the ocean.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: What's that like?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Well it's big. And it's blue ...  ... It's really really blue.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Mmmm.  Boy. It's hot up here.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: You want some berries?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Hunh?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: I picked them myself. They grow wild up here.  Mmm. So sweet.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: They just grow like that?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Oh yeah. There's a lot of stuff. Currants and strawberries ... Here. I'll show you.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Rain.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Real rain?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yeah ... You don't have rain either?

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: What do we do?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: We'll just put up the top.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: It's beautiful. Where'd you get it?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It was a prop for the school play ...

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Can I open it?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Sure ...

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: Where are they?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm not sure.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: You're gonna forget about me.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No I won't. I swear.

turns.speaker: MARGARET
turns.text: I like calling you David.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I like it too.

turns.speaker: HOWARD
turns.text: Okay, whose window did Bud break when he was playing with his father's golf clubs?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Easy. Mr. Jenkins. What JOB did Mr. Jenkins have?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Salesman. What did Bud and Mary Sue name the cat they found in the gutter?

turns.speaker: HOWARD
turns.text: Scout?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Marmalade.

turns.speaker: HOWARD
turns.text: You're unbelievable. You'll win this thing for sure. When is it on?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Marathon starts at 6:30. Contest's tomorrow at noon.

turns.speaker: HOWARD
turns.text: A thousand dollars ... And it's on all night?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Of course it is Howard. That's why they call it a Marathon.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Holy cow. Look at that. Had a little disaster didn't ya fella.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yeah ... Sort of ...

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: We'll get you fixed up in no time.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: I know how I'd feel if mine went out. Almost like losing a friend.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You know, we didn't call any TV repair.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Well that makes it a lucky day for both of us, hunh?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: ... Her father.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Right. And how did she dress him?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: ... Like Prince Charming.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Nice ... Nice ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yeah ...

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: What department store did they go to?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: McIntire's.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: McGinty's.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No. McIntire's. Remember:  "For the very best in men's attire, Head right down to McIntire's."

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Say--why don't you take this remote instead. It's got a little more "Ooomph" in it.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Ooomph?

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Sure. Big beautiful set like this--you want something that'll put you right in the show.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: How much does it cost?

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Oh--couldn't charge you for something like that. It's free.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: ... See, every time I thought I'd found someone they'd turn out to disappoint me. They'd know the early episodes, but they wouldn't know the later ones ... They'd know all about Muffin but they wouldn't know about Bud ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What the hell's going on!

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Shh! Can't talk like that now. You're in ...  You know ...

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Why would I do that?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Because we don't belong!

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Oh sure you do ... "McIntire's Department store" ... "Their father dressed as Prince Charming." That was gorgeous Bud.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: My name's David.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Look--we appreciate it. We really do. We just--we want to go home now.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: But you don't know how long I've been looking for someone like you.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Don't get upset.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Weil wouldn't you! You look for someone for years ... You pour your heart into it ... This is a privilege you know.  I don't think I better talk about this right now.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Where are you going ...

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: I don't think we should discuss this until I'm a little bit more composed.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: WAIT A MINUTE!!

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Maybe in a day or so when I'm not so emotional ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: COME BACK!!!

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Hello there.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Well c'mere, young fella.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: So even though I can't make any promises, well--I figured if you asked me real nice--I might just be willing to talk about it again.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Talk about it. Right now, I mean. I got to ... um ...

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Bud--I thought you wanted to come home.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh ... I do. Yeah. It's just that I told my "dad" I'd clean out the rain gutters and Mr. Johnson wanted me to ... to change the tape in the register ...

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: I'll be honest with you Bud. I'm getting sorta concerned about what I'm seeing in some of these re-runs ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Re-runs?

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Like when Margaret Henderson makes her cookies for Whitey.  ... Those aren't your cookies Bud.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh, I know they're not. But I mean-- they're just "cookies" after all ...

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Well they're not just cookies. I mean, they're great cookies ... Look, I'd love to get into this whole thing but I'm really running late. Why don't we hook up tomorrow?

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: BUD.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Terrific. I'll talk to you then.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: I want a word with you ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh--well ...

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: NOW!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: What do I MEAN!  You think this is a toy? You think it's your own little goddamn coloring book ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Look--it just sort of "happened" ...

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: A deluge doesn't just "happen." Bolts of lightning don't just "happen" ...  You burned down an ELM tree for Christ's sake ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I had nothing to do with that.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Oh. I'm sorry--refresh my memory. What episode does the orgy happen in, again?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Look ...

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: It was a gift Bud. It was so special. You liked these things as much as I did, remember: Warm smells in the family kitchen? A smile from a stranger? You know how rare that is?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: ... Only if they mean it.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: OKAY. NOW YOU'RE REALLY STARTING TO PISS ME OFF!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I didn't do anything wrong.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Oh no? Let me show you something!

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Where's the remote control I gave you?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Because you're coming home. I'm gonna put this place back the way it was.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No you're not.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: EXCUSE ME?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm sorry ... I can't let you do that.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: JUST GIMME THE GODDAMN REMOTE!

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: OW!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm going to leave now.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: You're not going anywhere. You're gonna get that remote and you're gonna come home and we're gonna make everybody HAPPY AGAIN!!!

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Hope you're proud of yourself.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I am actually ... Glad to see you've finally shown your true colors.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Okay, let's cut the shit and get right to it. Where's that remote control?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Because you're coming home.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Why don't you just take me back without it?

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Oh. You're a smart little bastard aren't you?  It's kind of like a restricted ticket. You gotta leave the same way you came.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: So ... I guess as long as I'm here, all sorts of things could happen to this place. We could have pink lawns and blue trees ...

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Just gimme the damn remote!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm sorry. I can't do that.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: I don't know what went wrong. You answered every question. You knew every detail. The senior Prom ... McIntire's Department Store. We had all the same warm memories: Sock hops. The Church Social ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: They weren't my memories.  I borrowed them. It's no good when you borrow them.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: How long do you think you've been here?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I don't know ... Three, four weeks.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Much less than that.  An hour and a half.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Now Buddy, you're going on trial tomorrow. And if they find you guilty, you're gonna be stuck here forever. Well, not forever--lemme think ...  Five year sentence ... Carry the three ... That comes out to ... sixteen and a half centuries, and that's rounding down.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'm going on trial tomorrow?

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: This is TV pal. They don't fool around.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: There's worse places.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Oh sure. For the first hundred years. Then it starts to get a little monotonous.  Sleep well.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Bud?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Sorry ... I had to help my folks and then I couldn't find my hat ...

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Well--I always wipe down the counter and then you set out the napkins and glasses and then I make the french fries ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yeah ...

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: But you didn't come so I kept on wiping.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You know, if this ever happens again, you can make the fries even if I haven't put out the napkins yet.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: I'm so glad you're here.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: There aren't any cheeseburgers.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Well, usually I put out the burger and then you finish with the lettuce ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Listen to me!

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Do you have the lettuce?

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: ... Yeah.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Have you cooked the burgers?

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Well you can just put on the lettuce, finish the burger and pretend it was me doing it all along.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh hi!

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Hi there. You took off so quick. I wasn't sure if you were okay.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh, yeah. Sorry. I'm fine. I just ... Had to get home early.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Bud ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yeah ...

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: You know how when we close up, I close the register, then you lower the shades, then I turn out the lights, then we both lock the doors.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yeah ...

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Well you weren't around this time so I did the whole thing myself.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Two cheeseburgers, two cherry cokes.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: There aren't any cheeseburgers.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Look. I thought we talked about this, I thought we said ...

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Oh--what's the point, Bud?

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Well ... I'm not sure I see the point anymore.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What are you talking about! You make hamburgers! That is the point!

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: No I know ... I know I do ...  But it's always the same, you know? Grill the bun, flip the meat, melt the cheese ... It never changes. It never gets any better or worse ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Just listen to me ...

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: ... Like the other night, when I closed up by myself. That was different ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Forget about that!

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Oh ... Okay.  ... But I really liked it.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Look, you can't always like what you do. Sometimes you just do it because it's your job. And even if you don't like it, you just gotta do it anyway.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: So they can have their hamburgers!

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: You know what I really like?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: ... What's that?

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Christmastime.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Wow ... That's pretty good ...

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Thanks.  But this morning I was thinking about it and I realized that I looked forward to it all year. And then I thought "Gee. That seems awfully silly. That seems like an awfully long time to be waiting for just one moment, don't you think?"

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Well don't you?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I think you should try not to think about this anymore.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Oh. Okay. I'll try that then.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Oh, hi.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Aren't you a little early?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I brought you something ... From the library.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It's an art book.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Oh my Gosh, Bud ...

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Open it.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: I'll never be able to do that.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Oh, well--you're just starting out. I mean, you can't do it ...

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: No, that's not it.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It's okay. We'll get you a new one.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: I don't know what I'd do if I couldn't paint anymore Bud. I just don't know what I'd do ...

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Well how do you know it won't go back to the way it was?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: You're gonna keep painting aren't you?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: It's beautiful.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNSON
turns.text: Just a little--You know.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: TV repair.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: TV repair?

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Yeah. TV busted?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Yeah ...

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Well here I am.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You think you could do this like soon? It's almost six thirty.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: What's the rush?

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Gosh, I loved that show. Watched it for years.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: That's not the reason. I've got a date at six thirty.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Hey--who did Muff in take to the masquerade ball when her date came down with the measles?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Um--hello? I've got like a social emergency here.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Remember the one where Bud lost his cousin when he was s'posed to be watching him?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Free?

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Oh sure. Big fan like yourself. It's the least I could do.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Told you it was your lucky day. Bet you thought I was just a fan or something.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: A miracle.

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Dream come true, hunh?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: This isn't funny! I happen to have a very important date in like five minutes!

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: Well, you don't have to worry about that anymore.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Oh GOD ...

turns.speaker: DICK VAN DYKE
turns.text: You know--this is a pretty strange way of showing your appreciation.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Saw you at the mall yesterday.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Yeah ... Saw you too.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: So you watching Pearl Jam on MTV tonight?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: So uh ... Maybe we could uh ...

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Cool.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Cool.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: This is Barry.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Hey it's me, what are you doing?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Hello, Karen. I'm just working.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Yeah but what are you doing?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: I'm just working....I have some customers here.....

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: So you can't talk to me?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: I have a few people here, I can't really chat right now.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: "chat?" Did you just say "chat?"

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Well, I can't talk though --

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: You just fucking said "chat," that is so -- what are you now? "chat." I'm just calling to make sure you show up at this party tonight.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Yes, I'll be there.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Fine. You get back to chatting with your precious customers.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Ok, bye-bye.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Did you think that we'd all be looking at you?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: No, no, no.

turns.speaker: KAREN
turns.text: Well it's just not true. We wouldn't be looking at you -- why are you wearing this suit? Did you say hello to your brother in law's?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: ...yes I'm still on hold...

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: And what was this?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: I'm looking at your advertisement for the airline promotion and giveaway?

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: This is "Fly With Us?"

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: It's hard to understand because it says in addition to but I can't exactly understand in addition to what because there's actually nothing to add it too...

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: I think that's a type-o then, that would be a mistake.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: So, just to clarify, I'm sorry: Ten purchases of any of your Healthy Choice products equals five hundred miles and then with the coupon the same purchases would value one thousand miles --

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: That's it.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Do you realize that the monetary value of this promotion and the prize is potentially worth more than the purchases?

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: I don't know...I mean: I don't know.

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: It's extension 215 if you want to try me back.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Ok. Thank you.

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: What city?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Somewhere in Utah.

turns.speaker: OPERATOR
turns.text: What's the listing?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: D&D Mattress Man.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Hey, how are you? BARRY I'm fine, hi, how are you?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I'm just stopping by to say hello.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: So you're coming tonight, right?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Yes, indeed, yes I am.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: There's this girl, this friend of mine from work that I think is really cute and really cool and I want you to meet her so I was thinking about bringing her to the party tonight.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Oh yeah no I don't want to do that.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Well I don't want to do something like that.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: She's my friend and you should meet her. You'd like her.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Yeah, but please don't do that.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I'm not really asking you, I'm telling you.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Yeah but please don't do that: everyone would be looking at me.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: It's a free country, we can look at you if we want to.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Yes but I get tense and I feel like I can't be myself if that happens.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: That's your fault not mine.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: I don't think I'm going to the party.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: So it's ok if I bring her.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Please don't.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: She's really cute and she's really nice.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: ...please, I just don't want it....

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: ....wait a minute: why is this about you now? Why is it always about you?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Yeah, no, it's not, it's just --

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I'm trying to be your friend.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I'm trying to get you a girlfriend.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Well, yeah, thank you, but --

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: -- but since you're not going I guess none of this matters and I'll bring her anyway.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Hey....I was just telling everyone about how I was gonna bring this girl for you but you wouldn't let me do it.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Hello everyone.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: You just said very food.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Did I say that?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: You're lucky. She couldn't come anyway --

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Well I'm glad you didn't, thank you.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: She couldn't come I said. Are you nervous?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: You look nervous.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: I'm not, I'm very happy.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Hey, what are you doing? Why are you wearing a suit again?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: This is Lena, she's a good friend of mine from work. We were in the neighborhood and she had to pick up her car and we're getting breakfast before we go in, so did you want to go? We're gonna go and eat, let's go.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: Yeah I can't.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: I have work, I can't leave.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Seriously, though: We're going to eat, I said.

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Hey, hey, you should ask her out -- what do you think, she's cute, right?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: I'm gonna call you back.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: It's not cool?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: It's fine, but --

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: -- do you think you'll ask her out?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: I feel really on the spot now.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Are you gonna do it?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: I don't do that. I don't - things like that.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: You don't do anything, why are you being scared?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: I'm not being scared, you're just going to rag me if I do this --

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I'm not gonna rag you. Why would I do this just to rag you?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I'll leave then, I'll go to get something from my car, go away so you don't feel pressure. Can I ask you a serious question:

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Did you ask Walter to get you a shrink?  Barry, did you ask Walter to get you a shrink? What's wrong with you? Are you ok?

turns.speaker: BARRY
turns.text: I didn't ask him that. He's lying.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: You're being weird again, see. Come on. Please don't be weird.
